intro: Calea intermedia, commonly known as the "Mexican nightshade," is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to purple, often with a distinctive pattern resembling a spider web. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests or along stream banks. Its leaves are usually broad and heart-shaped, with a velvety texture. Calea intermedia is also known for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in herbal remedies.
